summary: Alan G. Sentinella was a retired FBI Special Agent who testified before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) in May and June of 1975. His testimony primarily concerned FBI investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents highlight his involvement in these investigations, particularly regarding electronic surveillance, potential communist influence, and the FBI's operational policies. Sentinella's testimony aimed to provide insights into the FBI's activities during that period, focusing on the objectives and methods employed in monitoring King, the SCLC, and Levison. The documents also show that the FBI was responding to Congressional committee requests for information regarding COINTELPRO and other related matters.
